article:
A 'PEST sequence' is a peptide sequence which is rich in proline ('P'), glutamic
acid ('E'), serine ('S'), and threonine ('T'). This sequence is associated with
proteins that have a short intracellular half-life; hence, it is hypothesized
that the PEST sequence acts as a signal peptide for protein
degradation.

The degradation may be mediated possibly via the
proteosome or calpain.
